definition: to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax

sentences.english: "Rent-seeking" is a kind of economic phenomenon produced by government's interference .
sentences.chinese: “寻租”是政府干预产生的一类经济现象。

sentences.english: Robert Tollison, "Rent seeking is the expenditure of scarce resources to capture an artificially created transfer."
sentences.chinese: 寻租是耗费稀缺资源攫取的一种人为创造的财产转移。

sentences.english: Control of rent-seeking requires decentralisation of economic power.
sentences.chinese: 抑制寻租行为，要求分散经济权力。

sentences.english: In fact, power of rent-seeking is the phenomenon as power as the capital.
sentences.chinese: 权力寻租实际上是权力资本化现象。

sentences.english: It is rent-seeking in its most naked form.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种最赤裸的寻租形式。

sentences.english: Right rent seeking of inspector means to put privacy into the public right to obtain money and material interests.
sentences.chinese: 权力寻租者将公权化为私权，以谋取金钱和物质利益。

definition: to make use of one's position to gain profit for oneself or one's associates
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
covert activities (election rigging etc)/under-the-table manipulations/black operations
to damage the public interest for personal profit (idiom); personal profit at public expense/venal and selfish behavior
buying and selling of official positions
lit. to drill a hole/to take advantage of a loophole/to exploit an advantage/to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/see also 謀取|谋取[mou2 qu3]
see 暗箱操作[an4 xiang1 cao1 zuo4]
more hands than needed (idiom); too many cooks spoil the broth
